reviews.review_msg: One of the worst classes I have taken so far, she doesn't provide any slides for her students to look back at, she expects to take notes of every word. There are no assignment guidelines available in canvas. Boring lectures and boring instructor.

Worst professor I've had in my 4 years. Her lectures were confusing, jumping between unrelated concepts that were too abstract. Assignment details and lecture slides weren't on Canvas, and pop quizzes made no sense. The final exam took 4 hours and we also have a final assignment too. This class made no sense and had no connection to CMNS.

This was the most unorganized class I have ever taken. She posts no instructions for any assignments or even lecture slides on Canvas. The assignments are so confusing and horribly explained. The final exam was a complete joke. Instructions for any assignment / exam have so much detail that you get lost. I would not recommend taking her classes.

Kirsten is one of the worst professors I have ever had at SFU. She struggles to make anything in her class interesting, in every lecture, she fixates on minor details instead of covering the material. My favourite thing about Kirsten is she tells us to email her if we have questions but then never responds. Don't take any of her classes.

Kristen is one of the worst most unorganized professors I've had in my last 4 years at SFU. Do not trust the old reviews that gave her a 5/5 Idk what happened between 2014 and now but she is a horrible prof that forces you to come to class with pop quizzes and on paper assignments (if she didn't no one would come to her repetitive, boring classes).
I took this class online and it was fairly say. The midterm was very straightforward and the weekly activities were easy to do as well.
A troublesome outline and homework without examples

Chris is one of my favourite CMNS prof! Super nice and genuinely cares for his students. This was such a fun class because we got to use some really cool equipments and actually take what we learn and apply it. Would definitely take his classes again!

One of the worst professors in communications department, unorganized & definitely doesn't know what he is doing. Very clear that he is just there for a paycheque & does not care if you succeed. Told us to give him high ratings on here in class. Ends class early.

cancelled classes constantly. was very unreliable when asked for help outside of class. It felt like he was confused about the syllabus and it was very unorganized. He would end lectures super early. He would just trail off, not get back on track, then end class. strange guy and terrible lecturer

Everyone saying he's a bad prof for cancelling classes during Fall 2023 are ridiculous. It was annoying that so many classes were cancelled but he was just respecting the TA strike. 

I do wish he had prepared a bit more for the class, but considering it was his first time teaching it, it was pretty good and he was super nice and approachable.
Amazing professor, his lectures are super engaging and interesting. Also, the syllabus is so good and it was divided very equally. I love it!

GENUINELY the most unprepared disorganized teacher ever... I am beyond angry that we had to pay full tuition while he just cancelled more than half the lectures without reason. He is the definition of a privileged American white man. Super condescending and is of no help when you ask him anything.

Prof is a very personable guy, probably great outside of class but as a professor, he lacked. His lectures were all over the place, didn't follow the curriculum that he gave us so the readings we did for the week weren't relevant to that lecture. Marks were based on 4 things of which 3 were due last day of class.

If his teaching attitude is so unserious, he can choose not to be a professor. He is the worst professor I have ever met at SFU. He seems very nice but...He still canceled half of the semester's classes due to the strike and screwed our grade.

He is very irresponsible as a professor. He often piles up things from the previous class to the next class. The workload of the entire semester is piled into the last week, not considering the fact that students have other finals to prepare for, the average score is only 50 to 60.He is attitude is very bad. Can't learn anything but has a GPA bomb.

the dude made a midterm exam, final exam, and a 2000 word paper due on the same day on the last week of class totaling 75% of our grade. Both exams were written essays as well. The TSSU strikes did screw things up this semester but this was not a good way to handle things as I and many others also had other finals to focus on. Everyone did bad lol

He showed up to class without even preparing his slides,canceled half the semester.He seems friendly,but when you ask him something,he doesn't know what he talking about and he's condescending.Also he's the definition of a privileged American white man.All the homework was piled up in the last week.He only read the slides,you can't learn anything

Didn't prepare and canceled half of his lectures, he put everything on the last two days, a mess. Difficult marker, He didn't tell the grades for each assignment and just ended up with a horrible final grade. He won't tell you why or give you comments. he's condescending. His lectures always ended an hour early, a horrible, unorganized professor.

Absolutely horrible. He didn't plan any of the course or assignments so was just making everything up as he went along. Result was everything: 2 exams and a final paper being crammed into the last day of class. He also cancelled about half the classes the day of with no explanation. Totally disorganized and incompetent and not fit to be a prof
